benchmark_details.name: FINTAGGING
benchmark_details.overview: FINTAGGING is the first full-scope, table-aware XBRL benchmark designed to evaluate the structured information extraction and semantic alignment capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in the context of XBRL-based financial reporting.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs on their ability to perform full-scope XBRL tagging, including fact extraction and concept alignment.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark focuses primarily on US-GAAP financial reports and does not cover all global accounting standards.

data.source: Collected annual 10-K reports from publicly listed companies filed with the SEC.
data.annotation: Gold-standard annotations of numerical entity types and associated US-GAAP concepts.

methodology.calculation: Computed using pair-level metrics for FinNI and accuracy for FinCL.
methodology.interpretation: Performance threshold varies based on specific subtask; higher scores indicate better extraction and alignment.
methodology.baseline_results: Preliminary evaluation results show significant variance in performance across different models.
methodology.validation: Joint evaluation framework for structured triplet {Fact, Type, Tag} assessment.
